list_definition.definition: an untidy mess of paper, rubbish etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Put your litter in that bin.

list_definition.definition: a heap of straw etc for animals to lie on etc
a number of animals born to the same mother at the same time
to cover (the ground etc) with scattered objects

list_ex_of_english: The possible removal of fruits or seeds from litter traps by animals was carefully monitored and considered insignificant.
These data are representative of assays performed with two independent litters of rat pups.
Females were caged by litter and a density of four mice per cage was maintained.
This study reveals the importance of litter-cover on the interactions between seedlings, herbivores and pathogens, as well as on the performance of tropical seedlings.
Amount of leaf litter was estimated as the number of leaves pierced by a metal stake thrust into the soil at the site.
Breeding data were compiled from litters that were complete at classification and analysed using maximum likelihood methods.
Ponerinae have their main distribution in the litter, do also occur in litter vegetation, but nearly drop out in the canopy.
The single exponential model used to explain the temporal dynamics of litter decay fitted the data well, explaining 59-96% of the data variation.
